yeezus.memory

Class Memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • yeezus.memory.Memory

  • public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object
    A storage mechanism for Words in the yeezus operating system.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Mark Zeagler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Memory(int capacity)
      Constructs a new memory.memory device with the given capacity.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCapacity()
      Returns the storage capacity of this memory instance.
      Word read(int physicalAddress)
      Retrieves the data from the given physicalAddress as a Word.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Provides the memory as a list of words written in hex.
      void write(int physicalAddress, Word word)
      Writes the given Word to the given physicalAddress.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Memory

        public Memory(int capacity)
       throws InvalidWordException
        Constructs a new memory.memory device with the given capacity.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The size of the memory to be created.
        Throws:
        InvalidWordException

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public Word read(int physicalAddress)
          throws InvalidAddressException
        Retrieves the data from the given physicalAddress as a Word.
        Parameters:
        physicalAddress - The physical address of the location to be read.
        Returns:
        The Word stored at the given physical address.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressException - Thrown if the physical address given is outside of the scope of this memory.memory.

      • write

        public void write(int physicalAddress,
                  @NotNull
                  Word word)
           throws InvalidAddressException
        Writes the given Word to the given physicalAddress.
        Parameters:
        physicalAddress - The location where the Word should be written.
        word - The Word to be stored at the physical address.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressException - Thrown if the physical address given is outside of the scope of this memory.memory.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the storage capacity of this memory instance.
        Returns:
        The amount of Words this memory instance can store.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Provides the memory as a list of words written in hex. Each hex code is on its own line.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The memory as a list of Words written in hex.
